title: Help a n00b <3
body: So I'm starting to feel that 6 months ago was a bad time to start playing LOL, just as I got my head around the s4 meta, s5 came and rather confunlded me. So is there anyone on the OCE server who would like to help a lowly female gamer by explaining/showing/teaching me the mechanics for Sup, Mid & Top ? I prefer mage supports like Morgana and Karma but I'm open to learn anything and everything I can before I try give ranked a go ... help ?{{champion:32}}

replies.body:
mechanics are mostly play style when it comes to those roles. atleast in lane phase.

morg and karma supports are really telegraphed. just poke with your poke, CC with your CC when needed. dodge skill shots with shields and speed boosts.

nothing has changed in the meta from S4 to S5 for those roles.
ADC had some item changes towards the end of season 4, and some more just recently (shiv swapped to PD in most cases due to crit nerf on IE)
some mids have now had to find a replacement for DFG, but for a lot it was just a crutch so it hasnt shifted the meta for them.
jungle has had a massive shift with the changes to the jungle...but ultimately, the best junglers from before....are still miles ahead of others. its just the pathing and clearing that changed.
dragon control for everyone has increased, especially for 1st dragon. and dragon denial is also really important.
baron in view lost importance with the duration nerf, but it is still highly important for combating a 3+ dragon enemy, and in theory is stronger than a 5 dragon buffed enemy.

theres more, but i added you ingame on my smurf. so yeah....
Well I look forward to playing with you :) Thankyou for your advice and help so far
If you wanna play mid, just play brand easy game easy life
You can add me in game (yaiamone), I main Morg and Karma. Despite my low elo I could probably teach you some things.

"lowly female gamer" - pls don't say this kind of thing :|

Anyway though, since you are laning with someone else there is a chance they can be super rude to you on the smallest of mistakes, or try and blame you if lane is lost to save face.
The general idea is give ADCs the kills. However, if you think there is only a small chance that the ADC will get it, while you can easily secure the kill DO NOT HESITATE. They will probably flame you a little, but in the end they gotta just accept that you got them an assist and some time for easy farming, rather than the rather possible nothing at all.
Morgana and Karma, like you play, are good choices. I would suggest picking up Leona, Thresh or Braum as well though, for those occasions where your team has no tank so that you may do that too. All of them are excellent in lane anyway.
Early Sightstone is good too. It should be one of your first items. While everyone should be warding, in low ELOs people will be like "NOT WASTING MY MONEY, PLACE MORE WARDS SUPPORT". The amount of times I have had people tell me off for placing no wards when I have 3/3 wards and pink down D:.
Like on everyone, pink wards are nice. Placing them in places people don't often check is a good idea. It isn't gonna expire, and it will always come in handy at some point. That was as well, you won't be surprised if someone uses a path no one seems to use.
Also, wards... don't just place them in bushes. Its nice to have them in bushes, but having them outside of them can give you more information by letting you see a bunch of places people may walk through.

Sorry didn't mean to offend :) thank you so much for this :D even in pvp I find the ADC abuse can get really harsh. Most of it for KS when they can't kill confirm. I will deffo pick up Thresh Braum and Leona, it might give me better counter insight if I find I don't play them well. 

Are you able to tell me some better pathlanes to ward etc, I'm still a little green on common places to ward/check etc, I just sort of place with the "need vision, see vision" mantra xD

Imo, Morgana is one of the current strongest supports.
I have checked your end stats of your games in http://oce.op.gg/summoner/userName=Jinxisamisfit

A few things about supports
- Sightstone
In a few games there seems to be no sightstone in your inventory. Sightstone is a must for supports.

- Die protecting your adc or for team
Support who is kill hungry should not play support.
Support is supposed to die for your adc or team
be the meatshield for your team. But it doesnt mean support is ok to feed. Its all about common sense.

- Watch map and wards
I have met a number of supports who buy sightstone but rarely use it to wards the map. This is fail support
Support must always spam the warda in sightstone. Dont go back to base if you still have over 1 wards in your sightstone
Also watch map. Give warning to your team in any other lanes if you see enemy jungler is going to gank. Let the team know where the jungler is.

There are many more points to do as supports but this should help at least.

As Morgana, I usually rush zhonya them buy sightstone
I dont even buy shoe. Just rush sightstome while buying the 75g wards or 100g
After you have zhonya, ppl will fear you. Why?

Flash into enemy team, hit R, activate zhonya. Win. Repeat. Ggwp. Easy

Glhf with your games

I think the games where i have no sight stone, are the games where we've lost (5 towers and an inhib down and the other team has full towers etc) so I've sold it for an item.

Mmmm, yeah I try and stay away from the toxic players, I rush the post game chat if it's been abusive.

Karma is a great midlaner too. As long as you get morello + guise it doesnt really matter what you build after as it will do something useful.

For top I like sion, he can bully a lot of the meta tops out of lane, and he has a certain satisfaction to playing him. I also like to play shen sometimes, especially when I duo with my friend who plays a lot of ADC.

For supp personally I think nami is the best support, but karma is great. Janna is also a very strong and not too difficult support atm, but has no damage herself really.

For jg I would reccomend skarner, jarvan and udyr. All 3 are easy, and strong.

For ADC safe adc are usually best, ezreal, sivir are good.

play style isn't such an issue, it's in game knowledge and mechanics I'm after. Match ups/item build/champ knowledge etc but thankyou :)

mobafire.com and lolcounter.com is not a bad site for match-ups/item builds and champ knowledge but make sure the information is up to date. Probuilds.com is also pretty good for checking out item builds and what is being played a lot atm. Mechanics is just something you mostly develop from playing more and the same goes with game knowledge. New players aren't very good at punishing players when they stuff up and blow their cooldowns. Say for instance a Blitz misses his hook in bot lane early game; you know he can't do much for 16ish seconds and you can punish him during this time.
